Comment: Punishing the average person who’s not buying fentanyl precursors, just trying to get an ESP32 or a motor driver - that’s the real collateral damage here.  If safety was the concern, they could’ve targeted specific categories or blacklisted vendors. But this was about revenue, plain and simple. And it's working. prices have doubled overnight, and American alternatives still cost 3- 4x more.  Meanwhile, the big companies will still get exemptions or know how to route around these rules - and they’ll keep the tools of innovation to themselves while the rest of us get priced out.  You don’t protect jobs or safety by nuking access to global parts. You just push more people to stop building, stop learning, or go underground.  Anyone in either party pushing policies like this needs to be voted out. They’re not defending the economy - they’re choking it.
